benchmark_details.name: Development of a Dataset and a Deep Learning Baseline Named Entity Recognizer for Three Low Resource Languages: Bhojpuri, Maithili and Magahi
benchmark_details.overview: This paper focuses on the development of a Named Entity Recognition (NER) benchmark dataset for Bhojpuri, Maithili and Magahi, which are low resource languages. The dataset was annotated using 22 entity labels and is aimed at improving machine translation systems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop an NER dataset for Bhojpuri, Maithili and Magahi languages to improve machine translation systems from these languages to Hindi.

data.source: Annotated corpora from Bhojpuri, Maithili, and Magahi languages
data.size: 228,373 tokens for Bhojpuri, 157,468 tokens for Maithili, 56,190 tokens for Magahi
data.annotation: Annotated using a defined entity tagset and guidelines applicable for Indian languages.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores were calculated based on entity recognition results from the NER tools.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance of the NER tools.
methodology.baseline_results: CRF: Bhojpuri 70.56%, Maithili 73.19%, Magahi 84.18%; LSTM-CNNs-CRF: Bhojpuri 61.41%, Maithili 71.38%, Magahi 86.39%.
methodology.validation: The results were validated based on training and testing datasets split with a ratio of 80-20.
